title: NFT for translation rights

f6_assessments.q0: The problem identified in the proposal is vague (The publishing industry needs disruption). It is unclear why disruption is needed and what is the meaning of it. The statement requires to be rephrased in a clear and understandable manner. Also the proposed solution is presented in an unclear sentence, as it says about translator rights (copyrighting?) without specifying them. The proposer should enumerate the rights that will benefit by adopting NFT implementation into Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer enumerates the experience/skills necessary to implement the proposal, but they are not supported by evidence (links, whitepapers etc.)
The proposer knows the types and number of team members, but no evidence of their experience/skill is emphasized. (links to social platforms profiles, works completed etc.)
The budget is not outlined clearly and is not broken down into identifiable items (i.e. salary: 2x$10/h x 10h/week x 6 weeks = $1.200, stationary - $200, dBase interrogation for proprietary ownership of writings - $200 etc.).
It is unclear what is the goal of this proposal (what is to achieve), research & development being a vague achievement (what is the output of the research? what is to be developed based on the research results?).

The proposal has no timetable to complete the work (i.e. 1 month - research, 2 months - development and the proposer should set the metrics to measure the success of each stage).

There is no description of the resources (exception human resources) necessary to implement the proposal.

The proposer has not considered the challenges and the risks relevant to a successful implementation (what are the constrains for the working plan? i.e. specific legislation, access denied for some researches etc.)
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has no roadmap with milestones and no time horizon for achievement.
No metrics/KPIs are defined. (how many deliverables can be produces in predefined period of time?)
No clear and understandable description of the problem identified and for the solution that solves the problem. (should be rephrased in a clear and understandable manner for any outsiders)

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does adress a unique use case for NFT targeting a specific and often not mentioned area, translation rights. However, very little information is given in the proposal. It is unclear when comparing the problem solution and the detailed plan if the proposer wants to create NFTs for rights in publishing and translation, or if the proposal is for funding research on the possibilities of such. In order for being able to measure the impact of the proposal, it would need to include some detail in the problem statement, how this is connects to the challenge brief, how it would impact Cardano and a more clear description on how the solution connects to the problem. It would also be beneficial to have a plan for scalability, and a structured plan for networking, outreach etc. Therefore, I disagree that the proposal effectively adressess the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal lists 2 senior developers and one project manager, but no referral links or further information about the individuals. In order for the feasibility to be assessed, it would be good if the proposal included some links to previous projects, or a LinkedIn profile page, etc. There is a basic idea described and the story behind it, but the proposal would need a more detailed plan on what the proposers aims to achieve. Also, how are the funds intended to be allocated between the three team members? Is there an estimation of labour hours? How long will the research and development go on? All of these points are imperative in order to increase the credibility of the proposal. I strongly disagree that this proposal will be implemented successfully, due to the lack of information provided.
f6_assessments.q2: As described earlier, the goal on what the proposer wants to achieve is a bit unclear. If there would be a road map including milestones, short and long term goals on a time horizon, it would be easier to comprehend. It is promising that the proposer wants to publish the progress and development in open source, making the project have some level of transparency to the community and public. In order to increase the quality of the proposal, I would recommend also including some KPIs or metrics. Partly for the community to observe the progress, but also to have some check-in-points in the development phase for the team. For example, how many writers and publishers do you expect to reach out to/onboard after 3 months? 6 months? Will you reach out to different platforms via 3rd party, or to publishers and translators working freelance? How many NFTs do you expect to mint and connect after x amount of time, etc. There isn't a lot of information to lean on here, thus making it very difficult to measure the auditability of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is scanty, not detailed enough.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal lacks details of anything and cannot be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: Only the bulk amount stated, no details provided. Cannot be approved

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very short and lacks detail, I would like the team to rework the problem statement and solution to demonstrate how NFTs will be at the core of the business model proposed by the team. At the moment the problem statement only make a claim, it does not present a problem.
f6_assessments.q1: I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. I would like the team to expand on the responsibilities and deliverables of each member of the team, this allows insight on whether there is a work overload in one area. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has no roadmap and single line budget. I would like to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project based on a monthly timetable and connect the KPIs to milestones on the project roadmap (timeline). I would like to see the team create a solid roadmap -  develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, set technical development milestones for creating the product. I would like to see the budget developed beyond a single line entry and broken down into monthly spending, and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the developers must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the spending - thus the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: A generic problem has been stated but it is a little too broad in scope in order to design a solution that would effectively address the challenge. Having said that simply rewording the problem statement to target translation rights would make more sense. The potential value to the community is not entirely clear for what is essentially a research proposal. What will be the deliverables of the research? Perhaps a peer reviewed paper might have been a reasonable outcome to propose for this fund with the idea of utilising the research in a later fund.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the proposer may well be valid in terms of translation services but this proposal does not cast any light on previous projects work history. The Catalyst community needs to be able to validate experience in order to vote with confidence.  I do feel you have a legitimate research proposal and if you reframe the proposal to reflect this you may find they requested funds in the future.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal suffers from a lack of information. There is no breakdown of the budget and no metrics/KPI's for auditing. This means the Catalyst community will not be able to audit the progress of the project which is an essential criteria. I Would highly recommend collaborating with the Catalyst community to assist your proposal writing for future funds.

solution: NFT for translation rights in the publishing and translation industry
